p: Ultraviolet-B (UV-B) radiation could induce stress in plants, and consequently, promotes the production of secondary metabolites through elevated defense responses. It has been reported that of the two Astragalus varieties, A. mongholicus has the higher tolerance to UV-B. Liu et al. further profiled the metabolites, particularly the phenolic compounds of A. mongholicus, when subjected to UV-B radiation [ 19]. Overall, they found that UV-B radiation could induce a tissue-specific strong shift from carbon assimilation to carbon accumulation of phenolic metabolism in roots, and it was activated by the upregulation of some relevant genes.
